  <header class="post-header">
	<div class="col-sm-12">
    <h1 class="post-title" style="margin-bottom:.1em;">2014 Papers</h1>
    <p class="post-meta lead">Dec 30, 2014 | Zacharias</p>
	</div>
  </header>
	<div class="container">
    	When I was cleaning up around my office, I realized I had a pretty good stack of papers from my internetting around this last year. I figured a list would be helpful for me to compare against next year to see how I'm trending in my media consumption.

h4. Papers I printed out
"Give War a Chance":http://www.foreignaffairs.com/articles/55210/edward-n-luttwak/give-war-a-chance
"The Byzantine Generals Problem":http://research.microsoft.com/en-us/um/people/lamport/pubs/byz.pdf
"The Hadoop Distributed File System: Architecture and Design":https://svn.eu.apache.org/repos/asf/hadoop/common/tags/release-0.16.3/docs/hdfs_design.pdf
"Reading This May Harm Your Comptuer: The Psychology of Malware Warnings":http://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=2374379
"Apache Hadoop Goes Realtime at Facebook":http://dl.acm.org/citation.cfm?id=1989438
"Are New Technologies Undermind the Laws of War?":http://bos.sagepub.com/content/70/1/21.full
"Scrum and CMMI - Going from Good to Great":http://systematic.com/media/282227/Scrum_and_CMMI___Going_from_Good_to_Great.pdf
"A Five-Stage Model of the Mental Activities Involded in Directed Skill Acquisition":http://www.dtic.mil/get-tr-doc/pdf?AD=ADA084551
"Similarity Measures for Text Document Clustering":http://www.milanmirkovic.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/pg049_Similarity_Measures_for_Text_Document_Clustering.pdf
"Why Are Married Women Working More? Some Macroeconomic Explanations":http://www.philadelphiafed.org/research-and-data/publications/business-review/2004/q4/brq404ak.pdf
"Improving Passive Packet Capture: Beyond Device Polling":http://luca.ntop.org/Ring.pdf
"Privacy versus government surveillance: where network effects meet public choice":http://weis2014.econinfosec.org/papers/Anderson-WEIS2014.pdf
"Down for the Count? Getting Reference Counting Back in the Ring *":http://users.cecs.anu.edu.au/~steveb/downloads/pdf/rc-ismm-2012.pdf
"How Did Dread Pirate Roberts Acquire and Protect His Bitcoin Wealth?":http://www.bitcoin.fr/public/divers/docs/silk-road-paper.pdf
"Loop Recognition in C++/Java/Go/Scala":http://research.google.com/pubs/pub37122.html
"Squarified Treemaps":http://www.win.tue.nl/~vanwijk/stm.pdf
"Academic urban legends":http://sss.sagepub.com/content/44/4/638.full
"Ten Things Political Scientists Know that You Don't":http://faculty.georgetown.edu/hcn4/Downloads/Noel_Forum.PDF
"If money doesn't make you happy, then you probably aren't spending it right":http://www.wjh.harvard.edu/~dtg/DUNN%20GILBERT%20&%20WILSON%20%282011%29.pdf
"Go To Statement Considered Harmful":http://bioinfo.uib.es/~joemiro/teach/material/escritura/gotoharmfulCol.pdf

h4. Other Things I printed out that are not strictly papers
"Zero one infinity rule":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zero_one_infinity_rule
"Amdahl's law":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amdahl%27s_law
"Tivoization":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tivoization
"The Absolute Minimum Every Software Developer Absolutely, Positively Must Know About Unicode and Character Sets (No Excuses!)":http://www.joelonsoftware.com/articles/Unicode.html
"Semantic Versioning 2.0.0":http://semver.org
"Version Control Best Practices":http://www.git-tower.com/blog/version-control-best-practices/
	</div>
</div>
